channel.title: Client to Server help
channel.description:
Hey guys, I made a server and everything is fine and working, i can access it through moparscape client download and online, so can a friend on another computer. My problem is that before I am going to post the server, i need a client for it. I have many clients that I play, and i edited one of them, replacing the server IP with my server IP, but when I try and connect using the newly edited client, it logs in, but the playing screen is black, and then quickly logs me out again. Then when I try back on Mopar it works.... so it is not the server being nulled, it is something to do with the client or the client to server connection.... BTW: I have tried editing 2 clients and they both did not work :( Please help :D
What am i doing wrong/need to change to be able to play through my new client???
Thanks.. :D

item.title: Client to Server help
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Thanks for the suggestions, but I have tried the server on mopar and it worked fine, and this client is alot better then mopar
I have also tried another client…
Anyone else got any ideas? Could it possibly be because I am the one hosting the server??
BTW: The error message on the client cmd says:
Error: Packet lost type 2, refreshing connection
On the server cmd it says:
(Player name) is signing onto the server.
Loaded: 3
Game saved for (Player name)
ClientHandler: Client (Player name) disconnected[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 05, 2009, 02:26:46 pm[/size][hr]Found a way… mod please remove

Read full topic

item.title: Client to Server help
item.dc:creator: @lilwermscape_ftw lilwermscape_ftw
item.description:
@lilwermscape_ftw wrote:

I know that my cousins would use the silab client to play…
but when they go to certain areas of the map, they would lagg out.
When they would log back in it would show the game frame but the screen would be black and it would say “loading please wait” until you restart the client.

This would probably happen if certain parts of the map were not supported by the client (highly doubt that).
OR… If there was too much activity goin on in that certain area…
(ex… Too many objects, too many people, or too many NPC’s… in that area)

What ever area you are in, try to clear it out some.
If that doesnt work i would suggest using another client.

Read full topic
